Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevinin-1GHd (XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; BBL)
Sequence Information.Source: Hoplobatrachus rugulosus, China, Asia; skin, Guenther's Frog,Sylvirana guentheri,Hylarana guentheri(old), Asia

Literature Information.Literature:
Peptide discovery: Found in multiple species.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (80%) toBrevinin-1GHa.Activity: Active against S. aureus or MRSA (MIC 2-4 uM), E. coli (MIC 8 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 32 uM), C. albicans (MIC 4 uM).It binds LPS and shows anti-inflammatory effects by suppressing the release of TNF-alpha, IL-1beta, and IL-6 from mouse RAW 264.7 cells (Tian et al., 2023.Structure:  the peptide is random coiled in water and became helical in complex with SDS, LPS, or SDS+LPS.Animal model:mouse: inflammation model (acute edema) was established with carrageenan administration. IP injection of the peptide alleviated the swelling of the 
right paw of mice, thereby showing the anti-inflammatory effect in vivo as well.Replaced with a more active peptide 5/2020; formatted 4/2024; 8/2024
Literature Information.Author: Jiang Y, Wu Y, Wang T, Chen X, Zhou M, Ma C, Xi X, Zhang Y, Chen T, Shaw C, Wang L. 2020
Literature Information.Title: Brevinin-1GHd, A Novel Hylarana Guentheri Skin Secretion-Derived Brevinin-1 Type Peptide With Antimicrobial and Anticancer Therapeutic Potential
